description: This action starts the engagement by accepting an EngagementInvitation. The task is asynchronous and involves the following steps: accepting the invitation, creating an opportunity in the partner's account from the AWS opportunity, and copying details for tracking. When completed, an Opportunity Created event is generated, indicating that the opportunity has been successfully created in the partner's account.

parameters.name: Catalog
parameters.description: Specifies the catalog related to the task. Use AWS for production engagements and Sandbox for testing scenarios.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier provided by the client that helps to ensure the idempotency of the request. This can be a random or meaningful string but must be unique for each request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: Specifies the unique identifier of the EngagementInvitation to be accepted. Providing the correct identifier helps ensure that the correct engagement is processed.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A map of the key-value pairs of the tag or tags to assign. (dict) --- The key-value pair assigned to a specified resource. The key in the tag. The value in the tag.

nested_items.name: EngagementInvitationId
nested_items.description: Returns the identifier of the engagement invitation that was accepted and used to create the opportunity.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: If the task fails, this field contains a detailed message describing the failure and possible recovery steps.

nested_items.name: OpportunityId
nested_items.description: Returns the original opportunity identifier passed in the request. This is the unique identifier for the opportunity.

nested_items.name: ReasonCode
nested_items.description: Indicates the reason for task failure using an enumerated code.

nested_items.name: ResourceSnapshotJobId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Resource Snapshot Job created as part of this task.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp indicating when the task was initiated. The format follows RFC 3339 section 5.6.

nested_items.name: TaskArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task, used for tracking and managing the task within AWS.

nested_items.name: TaskId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the task, used to track the task's progress.

nested_items.name: TaskStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates the current status of the task.
